page.title: 15Acklington Lane & Vill.Pumps
page.content:
{Green Lane}is a public lane which runs close to Acklington. It is very rutted in places, often muddy and certainly not suitable for cars (although farmers occasionally drive tractors along it). It is thought to have been a main thoroughfare in Roman times, providing a link between the coast at Druridge Bay and inland regions. Today it is used only by walkers and nature lovers (and, of course, farmers).
In early Anglo-Saxon times, Acklington was almost certainly chosen as a settlement because of the slightly higher ground where the geological circumstances favoured the finding of springs. Today, 2{village pumps}still catch the eye of visitors, though sadly they are no longer in use. One pump has a small roof over it "to keep the water dry" say the villagers.
